title: Segmented control
summary: Segmented control allows users to select a single option, immediately changing the display to reflect their selection. It is used for switching views or view options, not for navigation.
preamble: The segmented control switches between views or to sort elements. The segmented control is good to use to provide the user with closely related choices that affect an object, state or view.

overview.title: Size
overview.section-content: The segmented control comes in two sizes large (default) and small.

overview.title: Behaviour
overview.section-content: Component acts as button and trigger a change on click. By default the first item is selected. Only one segment can be active simultaneously.

overview.title: Icons
overview.section-content: Each segment button has optional leading and trailing icons. Use icons when you need to reinforce the meaning of the label.

overview.title: Overflow
overview.section-content:
Segments can have different widths depending on the content, and if there are too many segments to fit in the container, scroll buttons will appear to the left and/or right.

Segment with can also be controlled individually on the segments using the `width`, `min-width` and `max-width` Style Expression properties.

dolist.text: Use max 5 options, try to have as few as possible.

dontlist.text: Don't use it to collect data in a form, in that case use radio button or select.
Don't use to navigate in different areas, use tabs for that.
Don't mix items with and without icon
Don't use it for actions, use buttons instead.

ux-text.title: Writing
ux-text.section-content:
In general, there is not much room for vast labels in segmented controls. Keep the text of the controls concise and simple.

*   Write short and to the point
    
*   Make it clear what content the user can expect when clicking
    
*   Only use upper case on the first word, or if it is a proper name or abbreviation

accessibility.section-content: All values we measure need to pass in order to give a check on the accessibility on all our components.

accessibility.title: Important considerations
accessibility.section-content: Uses default navigation: Tabs as normal and trigger on key-up with space and on key-down with enter.

accessibility.title: Selected
accessibility.section-content: Should be at least 3 options. Else it can be hard to know which one is selected when there is no extra selected icon.
